item.description: @DrSLMiller @StevenBeschloss I trust Garland to pursue justice. This is a deeply complex situation, it must be handled with strict attention to our laws and constitution.
item.source:markdown: @DrSLMiller @StevenBeschloss I trust Garland to pursue justice. This is a deeply complex situation, it must be handled with strict attention to our laws and constitution.

item.description: Re-upping since @Starbucks has ignored thls store. https://t.co/CN52agszVS
item.source:markdown: Re-upping since @Starbucks has ignored thls store. https://t.co/CN52agszVS

item.description: @featherty @ElieNYC I am deeply concerned. But Garland is a patriot, with an outstanding legal background. Just because we do not YET see evidence of the DOJ investigation and work product, it's reasonable to assume they are preparing for a SUCESSFUL prosecution, an extremely heavy lift.
item.source:markdown: @featherty @ElieNYC I am deeply concerned. But Garland is a patriot, with an outstanding legal background. Just because we do not YET see evidence of the DOJ investigation and work product, it's reasonable to assume they are preparing for a SUCESSFUL prosecution, an extremely heavy lift.

item.description: @stshank if you fix it, what will resale value be? what is scrap value now?
item.source:markdown: @stshank if you fix it, what will resale value be? what is scrap value now?

item.description: @ElieNYC @featherty I respectfully disagree r: Garland (and I in general love your work). This situation is a VERY tough problem, it has to be approached with great care.
item.source:markdown: @ElieNYC @featherty I respectfully disagree r: Garland (and I in general love your work). This situation is a VERY tough problem, it has to be approached with great care.

item.description: RSS may be coming back, at some level. Two data points: 1) @davewiner is working on a new RSS feed reader that looks promising. 2) from Scripting News: RSS is on fire again, and it's all down to SlackOps. https://t.co/5J7xQztMTZ
item.source:markdown: RSS may be coming back, at some level. Two data points: 1) @davewiner is working on a new RSS feed reader that looks promising. 2) from Scripting News: RSS is on fire again, and it's all down to SlackOps. https://t.co/5J7xQztMTZ

item.description: @ringo_osu @AngryBlackLady @sarahkendzior I respectfully disagree. The rule of law will prevail. Garland has to put together an airtight case. That takes time.
item.source:markdown: @ringo_osu @AngryBlackLady @sarahkendzior I respectfully disagree. The rule of law will prevail. Garland has to put together an airtight case. That takes time.

item.description: @mims When will we start treating climate change as the existential threat it is? It's close to being too late... See the recent news about drastic decline of plankton.
item.source:markdown: @mims When will we start treating climate change as the existential threat it is? It's close to being too late... See the recent news about drastic decline of plankton.

item.description:
The Starbucks at Grand & Elm in Arroyo Grande, CA needs attention, broken door/windows for WEEKS. https://t.co/yCckUEpOl8 https://t.co/CcXxylhvoD @Starbucks

Howard Schultz must be very proud. For the win, the trash can was overflowing when I visited.

item.description: Interesting. E.g.: At the turn of the 20th Century, breakfast was revolutionised once again by American John Harvey Kellogg. He accidentally left some boiled maize out and it went stale. He passed it through some rollers and baked it, creating the world's first cornflake. https://t.co/wBGoG9LLdT
item.source:markdown: Interesting. E.g.: At the turn of the 20th Century, breakfast was revolutionised once again by American John Harvey Kellogg.
